title: I LOVE LISTS
description: I LOVE LISTS Inventors who succumbed to their own doom. Photos that make you go hmmm. I wish I read this 13 years ago- Pros/Cons living in childhood home. Some ways to refresh a space without buying anything. All of the quilts in this shop are incredible! Don’t be hard on yourself for skipping a workout. I totally forgot where the Simpsons got their start! How Disney animated Sex Ed in 1946 (year my parents were born) Learn the history of a McDonald’s breakfast sandwich. I need to add more ornamental grass to my yard. OMFG- almond croissant bars, yes please. Maybe this is why I have so many hot dogs in my algorithm. I can see why Reese’s discontinued these candy flavors. Let’s look at 60s studio portrait photos—so many fun hairdos. A Nonwriter’s guide to writing a lot. (very helpful) I learned the term “wet room” this week. I can’t believe this was all done with spraypaint. Wow. A brief history of fat fads in America. What causes brain freeze? Here are my favorite journaling supplies! Check out my February pages on The Handwriting Club Help me Help YOU! Here’s 40% off your first Thrive Market order. – I saved $450 last year! Buy something from my Etsy shop! You help me pay for my health insurance while you’re working on a planner! Use my affiliate link to get a free month of Skillshare premium! Want extra discounts and cashback on online purchases? I use Rakuten religiously! The post I LOVE LISTS appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: I Love Lists is a weekly roundup of the best links from around the internet, curated by Tracy Benjamin of Shutterbean. Discover inspiring reads, creative ideas, delicious recipes, and fun finds every week!
text: While I absolutely love the look and feel of an open bathroom and even enjoy them in hotels, I am a SUPER hot shower kinda guy, and I absolutely need walls to create that steamy environment. EVERY wet room shower I’ve experienced fell like I was half=bathing. Reply
html:
While I absolutely love the look and feel of an open bathroom and even enjoy them in hotels, I am a SUPER hot shower kinda guy, and I absolutely need walls to create that steamy environment. EVERY wet room shower I’ve experienced fell like I was half=bathing.

Reply
